attributes.action: Introduce a fuel price cap and/or tax reduction to combat the energy crisis
attributes.additional_details: In the last year fuel and energy prices have increased by at least 50-60% leaving many British households already struggling to make ends meet in a dire situation.  Minimum wage is due to increase by a mere 6% in April, which is not comparative to the inflation of fuel, energy and other bills which have increased the cost of living exponentially.  The current direction of the economy is on an unsustainable path forcing millions below the poverty line.
attributes.background: Introduce a fuel price cap and/or a fuel duty and VAT reduction to combat the current energy and cost of living crisis before the economy reaches a critical point at risk of potential collapse.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Set up an independent regulator to monitor and regulate vehicle fuel pricing: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/605282

Reduce fuel duty and VAT by 40% for a period of 2 years: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599089
